entry.title: Signage
entry.content:
My first official chalk job was with Southpaw BBQ and Southern Cooking back in 2013. I came in one night and tried to order some specials off the huge chalkboard hanging above their kitchen. When they said they didn’t carry it anymore, I jokingly poked, “Then why is it still up there!” They told me that their chalk person just moved away and that they were looking for a new one. I gave a lil peep that I may be able to help and boom—history. I’ve been hooked ever since!

You can check out more of my signage work here.

entry.title: TEDP
entry.content: I was brought to TEDP to be their Social Media / Media Communications Specialist but contributed more than my job title because of my background in design. I took on the role of rebranding TEDP by providing a clean new look to their logo, taking advantage of Squarespace for their website, and updating photos - including the board members on staff.

entry.title: Rickshaw Bagworks
entry.content:
BAYCAT is an extremely active nonprofit that focuses on youth education and empowerment through creative outlets, especially with digital media. I was a graphic design intern there back in 2009 and have made long lasting connections that they've often hired me back for projects.

Using the footage that interns have shot the previous week, I along with other students, we individually edited our own pieces to potentially be for Rickshaw Bagwork's promo - and mine was chosen!

entry.title: DIY
entry.content:
When I found out about DIY, an online equivalent kid scout where anyone can look up tutorials to learn a skill, earn badges (virtually & physically!), and share their masterpieces - I was ecstatic. So much so that I wanted to create something of my own. Since they already had a fun logo, I wanted to make an animated gif out of it.

I showed the DIY team and they loved it. They requested an inverted version to put it as the opening screen to log into their mobile app!

entry.title: Mong Thu
entry.content: Working alongside Jeffrey Larrimore, we were able to create a brand and identity for this Vietnamese comfort food restaurant. We were also able to diversify their clientele and promoted the establishment by creating a website and social media channels, all of which they did not have before. It was an enriching project and we enjoyed all the delicious research!

entry.title: Claws and Fangs
entry.content: I used the audio from Swingers to animate the characters from Trent's analogy of Mike's lack of dating skills. It's probably one of my favorite parts from the movie.

entry.title: Motion Graphics
entry.content: This is a piece I did for school using motion typography with existing audio. Dave Chappelle is one of my top comedians and I laughed the entire time I was editing. In this clip he speaks of the beloved Tenderloin district in San Francisco, where I was raised half my life.

entry.title: Comics
entry.content:
I grew up copying cartoons and comics. After some time I realized I could create my own. I used to draw comics for my high school newspaper and once I was out I didn't stop. I am always inspired by what friends and family say, events that take place, and everyday life.

Read more here.

entry.title: Mini Animations
entry.content:
A series of short animations I created for class assignments.

Bones - animate a walking sequence and reaction.

Cheese please - tell a story.

Metamorphosisosisosis - animate metamorphosis.

entry.title: Mengtendo
entry.content: Our final project in my Animation II class was to animate sound effects. After scoping the internet, I came across a ton of game-related sound effects that gave me a rush of nostalgia. Right then I knew exactly to do, re-create the old Nintendo role-playing-games that I grew up with. Turn up your speakers!

entry.title: Swank
entry.content: I designed these flyers to promote various events at Swank, a cocktail lounge in San Francisco, which happened to have amazing turn outs and fun times!
